Miles Sound System SDK 6.1c

AIL_set_3D_sample_effects_level

The function AIL_set_3D_sample_effects_level controls the amount of room effects that are applied by AIL_set_3D_room_type.

void AIL_set_3D_sample_effects_level(
  H3DSAMPLE S,
  F32 effects_level
);

In Parameters

S
indicates the sample handle to control.
effects_level
is the amount of room effects to apply to the sample.

Discussion

On most providers, setting the room type to ENVIRONMENT_GENERIC will turn off all room effects. On EAX, EAX 2, Fast 2D, and Dolby, however, you still need to call this function to completely turn off all room effects.

You must use the AIL_set_3D_sample_effects_level on most samples when using the Fast 2D or Dolby providers, or your CPU-usage will be extremely high. On the Miles 2D providers, each sample with room effects costs about 7% on a P5/200 (3% on a Pentium II).

Example files that use this function: EXAM3D.C


Group: 3D Digital Audio Services

Related Basic Types: F32, H3DSAMPLE, MILES_ROOM_TYPE, void
Related FAQs: How do I set an EAX reverb room style?
